item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (761 points | 262 comments)
2. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (518 points | 385 comments)
3. IAC confirms existence of a Super-earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like Star (310 points | 206 comments)
4. Composable SQL (98 points | 34 comments)
5. What's OAuth2, anyway? (143 points | 29 comments)
6. Maxima in the browser using Embedded Common Lisp on WASM (195 points | 43 comments)
7. Libraries and Well-Being: A Case Study from The New York Public Library (174 points | 79 comments)
8. Discovery Coding (110 points | 34 comments)
9. Apple and SpaceX link up to support Starlink satellite network on iPhones (69 points | 30 comments)
10. Malimite – iOS and macOS Decompiler (145 points | 18 comments)
11. Using uv as your shebang line (315 points | 103 comments)
12. TokenVerse: Multi-Concept Personalization in Token Modulation Space by Google (75 points | 13 comments)
13. Promising results from DeepSeek R1 for code (806 points | 589 comments)
14. Recreating Delicious Library in 2025? (29 points | 13 comments)
15. DeepSeek's multi-head latent attention and other KV cache tricks (224 points | 38 comments)
16. The History of Toontown’s SpeedChat (60 points | 18 comments)

18. A new ability to pinpoint sources of fast radio bursts (40 points | 3 comments)
19. Two Bites of Data Science in K (46 points | 10 comments)
20. Show HN: Meelo, self-hosted music server for collectors and music maniacs (90 points | 17 comments)
21. Desmos Animated Graphing Calculator (173 points | 24 comments)
22. SciPhi (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
23. We're bringing Pebble back (2636 points | 667 comments)
24. Machine learning and nano-3D printing produce nano-architected materials (36 points | 5 comments)
25. Watch the path of a raindrop from anywhere in the world (77 points | 27 comments)
26. Public Access OpenVMS System (82 points | 41 comments)
27. FTC takes action against GoDaddy for alleged lax data security (274 points | 140 comments)
28. DeepSeek's AI breakthrough bypasses industry-standard CUDA, uses PTX (73 points | 13 comments)
29. Show HN: Design/build of some parametric speaker cabinets with OpenSCAD (56 points | 21 comments)
30. Can we get the benefits of transitive dependencies without undermining security? (71 points | 62 comments)
